question_text: Which two practices improve cable management at a punchdown block? (Select two)
answer_options: Leaving extra cable slack to prevent tension
Cutting all cables to the exact same length before routing
Labeling cables and following a consistent routing path
Removing all twist from pairs before termination
correct_answer: Leaving extra cable slack to prevent tension
Labeling cables and following a consistent routing path
explanation: Good cable management involves slack for movement and labels for easy identification and troubleshooting.
